subject: Creative Commons 3.0 Attribution license
body:
Hi,I plan to file an ITP and package a cute small game called "Which Way Is Up?" ( http://hectigo.net/puskutraktori/whichwayisup/ ) and maintain it.
All the game code is licensed under the GPL 2.0. All the game content, sounds and graphics are licensed under Creative Commons 3.0 Attribution license ( 
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/ ).As I understand, CC-by 3.0 is DFSG-free. The only potentially DFSG-freeness problem I can see is the DRM limitation, and then again GNU FDL also has it and is perfectly DFSG according to the last GR about it.
Anyway, I prefer to ask about it first: Does anyone know if CC-by 3.0 is DFSG-free or not for sure, shall I go ahead and put it in the repositories?Greetings and thanks,Miry
